- {{< var course.dates >}} - {{< var course.time >}} - {{< var course.location >}} - [{{< var course.url >}}]({{< var course.url >}}) ::: ::: ::: ## Who are you? ![](img/group3.png){.absolute bottom="0%" left="0%" height="400px"} ![](img/group2.png){.absolute bottom="0%" left="15%" height="400px"} ![](img/group1.png){.absolute bottom="0%" left="33%" height="400px"} ![](img/group4.png){.absolute bottom="0%" left="50%" height="400px"} [What do you already know about inequality and what do you expect of this course?]{.bubble .bubble-bottom-right .absolute top="15%" right="0%" style="max-width:400px;--bubcol: var(--bubcol-dred); font-size:1.8rem;"} ## Schedule ```{r packages} #| include: false library(tidyverse) library(readxl) library(glue) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) Sys.setlocale(locale="en_US.UTF-8") schedule <- read_xlsx("../../data/schedule/schedule.xlsx") ``` ::: {.schedule-table} ```{r table} #| echo: false #| results: 'asis' schedule %>% arrange(Date) %>% select(-c(Chart)) %>% mutate(Assignment = ifelse(!is.na(Assignment), glue(''), glue('')), Date = format(Date, '%b %d, %Y')) %>% kbl(escape = FALSE, align = "cclcc", table.attr = 'class="schedule-table"') %>% kable_styling() %>% column_spec(1:2, width = "15%") %>% column_spec(3, width = "40%") %>% column_spec(4:5, width = "15%") ``` ::: ## Assignments {.smaller} While assignments 1 [@piketty:2014] and 3 [@stockhammer:2013] are mandatory, students may choose between 2 [@milanovic:2015] and 4 [@atkinson:2014]. Please write a summary of the provided paper with a [**limit of 400 words**]{.marker-hl} and upload it on the [learning platform](https://learn.wu.ac.at). The submission deadline is [**9 a.m. on the day of the respective teaching unit**]{.marker-hl}. You can structure your text around the following questions: - What is the research question? - Why is this question interesting? - How does the author approach and answer this question? - What are the main findings? - Is the paper credible? Why? Why not? ## Essays & Posters {.smaller} ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ### Research Proposal ::: {.altlist} - Introduction - Literature review - [Research question]{.circle-hl} and hypotheses - Methodology - Data - Conclusion - Bibliography ::: [**Deadline: January 31, 2023**]{.marker-hl} ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ### Poster ::: {.altlist} - Title - Author - Brief literature review - Highlights of your research proposal [research gap, research question, data, method]{style="font-size:1.3rem"} - Conclusion [What do you expect? Why is your research policy-relevant?]{style="font-size:1.3rem"} - References ::: [**Deadline: Date of the poster session**]{.marker-hl} ::: ::: ## Poster Session I {.medium} ```{r readbib} #| include: false #| cache: false library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) library(janitor) library(bib2df) bibfile <- bib2df("../../data/lit/wipol_spec.bib") %>% clean_names() %>% select(bibtexkey, keywords) bibtable <- bibfile %>% mutate(topic = case_when( keywords == "taxation" ~ "Taxation and tax evasion", keywords == "global" ~ "Developments in global inequality", keywords == "gpg" ~ "Gender pay gaps", keywords == "wealthgap" ~ "Gender and migrant wealth gaps", keywords == "wageled" ~ "Functional distribution and growth", keywords == "fiscal" ~ "Restrictive fiscal policy and inequality", keywords == "intgen" ~ "Intergenerational mobility", keywords == "dina" ~ "Distributional National Accounts (DINA)", keywords == "wealth" ~ "The distribution of wealth", keywords == "inherit" ~ "Inheritances and wealth inequality", keywords == "redist" ~ "Inequality and preferences for redistribution", keywords == "climate" ~ "Inequality and climate crisis", keywords == "history" ~ "Historical evolution of inequality", keywords == "pareto" ~ "The missing top in wealth data", keywords == "elites" ~ "Inequality and political elites", keywords == "power" ~ "Power in economics"), bibtexkey = paste0("@",bibtexkey)) %>% mutate(keywords = factor(keywords, levels = c("history", "global", "dina", "gpg", "wealth", "wealthgap", "pareto", "inherit", "intgen", "wageled", "fiscal", "taxation", "climate", "elites", "redist", "power"))) %>% filter(!is.na(topic)) %>% arrange(keywords) printtab <- bibtable %>% group_by(keywords, topic) %>% summarise(papers =paste(bibtexkey, collapse = "; ")) %>% ungroup() %>% mutate(rank = row_number(), session = ifelse(rank < 9, 1, 2)) ``` ::: {.poster-table} ```{r postertable1} #| echo: false #| warning: false #| cache: false #| results: 'asis' printtab %>% arrange(rank) %>% select(rank, topic, papers, session) %>% filter(session == 1) %>% kable(align = "cllc", format = "markdown", table.attr = 'class="poster-table"', col.names = c("#","Topic","Starting literature","Session")) %>% kable_styling() %>% column_spec(1, width = "5%") %>% column_spec(2, width = "35%") %>% column_spec(3, width = "50%") %>% column_spec(4, width = "10%") ``` ::: ## Poster Session II {.smaller} ::: {.poster-table} ```{r postertable2} #| echo: false #| warning: false #| cache: false #| results: 'asis' printtab %>% arrange(rank) %>% select(rank, topic, papers, session) %>% filter(session == 2) %>% kable(align = "cllc", format = "markdown", table.attr = 'class="poster-table"', col.names = c("#","Topic","Starting literature","Session")) %>% kable_styling() %>% column_spec(1, width = "5%") %>% column_spec(2, width = "35%") %>% column_spec(3, width = "50%") %>% column_spec(4, width = "10%") ``` ::: ## Grading
Assignments: 30\% [(0-10 points for each homework)]{.grey600 style="font-size:1.8rem;"}

. . . Poster presentation: 30\% [(0-20 points for the quality of the presentation, 0-10 for the poster style and structure)]{.grey600 style="font-size:1.8rem;"}

. . . Essay/Research proposal: 40\% [(0-40 points for the essay)]{.grey600 style="font-size:1.8rem;"} ::: aside ::: { style="font-size:1.5rem" } {{< fa regular face-grin-stars >}}   100-90: Excellent   {{< fa regular face-smile >}}   89-80: Good   {{< fa regular face-meh >}}   79-65: Satisfactory   {{< fa regular face-rolling-eyes >}}   64-50: Sufficient
[All single tasks have to be passed]{.marker-hl} (50% threshold each). ::: ::: ## Feedback and Evaluation {.medium} Let me know your [feedback]{.marker-hl} on the course anytime. If possible, I will try to incorporate your feedback immediately. At least, I will consider it for future courses. Additionally, there will be an anonymous [online evaluation]{.marker-hl} at the end of semester. You are asked to fill in the evaluation in class in one of the two January sessions. Please take part in the online evaluation even if you cannot be present in these session. ## Bibliography {.bibstyle} :::footer :::
